definitions.definition: an area of water in a port that can be closed off and that is used for putting goods onto and taking them off ships or repairing ships
a group of these areas of water in a port and the buildings around them:
examples: The strike has led to the cancellation of some ferry services and left hundreds of passengers stranded at the docks.

definitions.definition: a long structure built over water where passengers can get on or off a boat or where goods can be put on and taken off

examples: As a punishment, the Army docked the soldiers' pay/wages by 20% and took away their leave.
